deltaTradingQuantity.description: the change in the position size from the account’s trading activities

mtmPnl.description: mark to market profit (losses) accumulated since the last settlement

fundingPnl.description: funding profits (losses) accumulated since the last settlement. Applicable for perpetuals only.

settlementMarkPrice.description: market price at which the position was settled for this past cycle

settlementIndexPrice.description: index price at which the position was settled for this past cycle

settlementFundingRate.description: funding rate at which the position was settled for this past cycle. Applicable for perpetuals only.

settlementDatetime.description: Denotes the time the position was settled by the exchange, ISO 8601 with millisecond as string

settlementTimestamp.description: Denotes the time the position was settled by the exchange, number of milliseconds since EPOCH

requestId.description: unique identifier of the transfer request

symbol.description: asset or market symbol. Eg `USDC` for asset and `BTCUSDC` for market
asset or market symbol. Eg `USDC` for asset and `BTCUSDC` for market

price.description: reference price for asset or market

feeGroupId.description: Identifier for this particular fee tier

positions.description: portfolio position to be used in simulation

orders.description: pending orders to be used in simulation

referencePrices.description: reference price to be used in simulation

symbol.description: Symbol of the option market. For example `BTC-USDC-20241004-70000-C`

baseSymbol.description: Base symbol of the option market. For `BTC-USDC-20241004-70000-C`, it will be `BTC`

settlementAssetSymbol.description: Asset used for Mark To Market settlement

bidIVPercentage.description: Implied volatility of the best bid price

askIVPercentage.description: Implied volatility of the best ask price

bid.description: Bid price in the order book

ask.description: Ask price in the order book

underlyingPrice.description: Index price of the base asset

optionStrikePrice.description: Strike price of the option market

markPrice.description: Mark Price of the option market

openInterest.description: Amount of outstanding contracts in the exchange

openInterestUSD.description: USD value of outstanding contracts in the exchange

optionType.description: Specifies if it’s a call (right to buy) or a put (right to sell)

delta.description: Sensitivity of an option’s price to a $1 change in the price of the underlying asset

gamma.description: Rate of change of Delta with respect to a $1 change in the underlying asset’s price

theta.description: The rate at which an option’s price decreases as it approaches its expiration date

vega.description: Sensitivity of an option’s price to a 1% change in the implied volatility of the underlying asset

collateralUSD.description: total collateral across all assets in this trading account displayed in the reference asset in USD

borrowedUSD.description: total borrowed across all assets in this trading account displayed in the reference asset in USD

initialMarginUSD.description: The minimum margin one must maintain in order to be able to purposefully increase risk

warningMarginUSD.description: The minimum margin when the customer will receive warning via email/notifications over UI

liquidationMarginUSD.description: The minimum value of margin one must maintain in order to avoid liquidation

fullLiquidationMarginUSD.description: The value of margin when full liquidation occurs

defaultedMarginUSD.description: The value of margin when this trading account will be moved into a Defaulted state

liquidityAddonUSD.description: expected market impact of unwinding the portfolio in the case of a liquidation event

marketRiskUSD.description: the worst possible loss on the portfolio based on scenario analysis

FundingRateHistoryResponse.description: Hourly Funding Rate History of one market

updatedAtDatetime.description: date time of the last funding rate update for the hour

CreateOtcTradeCommand.description: A command with details to an OTC trade

commandType.description: Specifies the command type and must be ‘V1CreateOtcTrade’ to indicate the submission of an OTC trade.

isTaker.description: denotes whether the role of the counterparty is Taker or Maker. The corresponding leg of the opposite side of the trade should have the inverse role to be successfully matched on the OTC Clearing Facility

trades.description: all trades for the OTC trade

example.remarks: first otc trade with xyz client

TradeInOtcRequest.description: A trade of an OTC trade

statusReason.description: status reason, describes why the otc trade is in a specific state

createdAtDatetime.description: denotes the time the otc trade was ACK'd by the exchange, ISO 8601 with millisecond as string

createdAtTimestamp.description: denotes the time the otc trade was ACK'd by the exchange

expireDatetime.description: denotes the time the otc trade would expire

expireTimestamp.description: denotes the time the otc trade would expire, ISO 8601 with millisecond as string

trades.description: all trades for the OTC trade

OtcTradeLegView.description: a trade of an OTC trade

quoteAmount.description: notional value of the trade in quote or settlement asset, see [asset value](#overview--price-and-quantity-precision) format

tradeRebateAmount.description: trade rebate fee, see [ asset value ](#overview--price-and-quantity-precision) format

isTaker.description: denotes whether the role of the counterparty is Taker or Maker. The corresponding leg of the opposite side of the trade should have the inverse role to be successfully matched on the OTC Clearing Facility

createdAtDatetime.description: denotes the time the trade was executed by the exchange, ISO 8601 with millisecond as string

createdAtTimestamp.description: denotes the time the trade was executed by the exchange

CreateOtcTradeResponse.description: A response for an acknowledged OTC trade creation request

message.description: message indicating the status of the request

CancelOtcTradeCommand.description: A command to cancel an OTC trade. Only one of `clientOtcTradeId` or `otcTradeId` can be used in the cancel OTC trade command

commandType.description: Specifies the command type and must be ‘V1CancelOtcTrade’ to indicate the cancellation of an OTC trade.

CancelOtcTradeResponse.description: A response for an acknowledged OTC command to cancel an OTC trade

message.description: message indicating the status of the request

CancelAllOtcTradesCommand.description: A command to cancel all pending OTC trades.

commandType.description: Specifies the command type and must be ‘V1CancelAllOtcTrades’ to indicate the cancellation of all pending OTC trades.

CancelAllOtcTradesResponse.description: A response for an acknowledged OTC command to cancel all pending OTC trades

message.description: message indicating the status of the request

OtcMarketSymbol.description: market symbol. Eg `BTC-USDC-PERP` for PERPETUAL market `BTC-USDC-20250613` for DATEDFUTURE market and `BTC-USDC-20250613-100000-C` for OPTION market

SharedMatchKey.description: Unique shared key that is agreed between the two customers to represent their OTC trade to be matched on Bullish's OTC Clearing Facility. Must be a 12 to 64 characters alphanumeric value

TradeSideAsString.description: trade side can have the following string values `BUY`, `SELL`

OtcMatchId.description: unique numeric (i64) identifier generated on Bullish side expressed as a string value

ClientOtcTradeId.description: unique numeric (i64) identifier generated on the client side expressed as a string value

OtcTradeId.description: unique numeric (i64) identifier generated on Bullish side expressed as a string value

OtcTradeExternalStatus.description: otc trade status can have the following string values `"COUNTERPARTY_PENDING"`, `"COUNTERPARTY_PAIRED"`, `"RISK_PENDING"`, `"MATCHED"`, `"CANCELLED"`, `"REJECTED"`

Remarks.description: text field for client’s internal reference to a trade, max length is 255 characters
Remarks.example: first otc trade with xyz client

message.description: If there are no market maker protection configurations setup for this trading account or for the provided optional symbol under the same trading account, this field will be returned as "No mmp config setup".

mmpConfigurations.description: A list of market maker protection configurations that the user has setup for each underlying asset symbol under the trading account provided. Supports filtering of symbol.

windowTimeInSeconds.description: Time window during which the MMP checks are conducted. It helps in determining how frequently the system evaluates the market maker's activity against predefined thresholds. Value needs to be `> 0`. Maximum value is 600 seconds (10 minutes).

frozenTimeInSeconds.description: The duration for which a market maker’s trading activity is temporarily halted after a protective measure is triggered. Value needs to be `>= 0`. Maximum value is 3600 seconds (60 minutes).

quantityLimit.description: Cap on the total number of contracts that a market maker can trade within `windowTimeInSeconds`. This is direction(side) agnostic. Needs to be `> 0` if set.

deltaLimit.description: Net delta exposure that a market maker can accumulate within `windowTimeInSeconds`

isActive.description: This boolean indicates if this configuration is in effect or not.

CancelOrderCommand.description: Only one of `orderId` or `clientOrderId` can be used in the cancel order command
